definition: Changshou suburban district of Chongqing municipality, formerly in Sichuan
Changshou suburban district of Chongqing municipality, formerly in Sichuan

sentences.english: I did 30-day trials both with the macrobiotic diet and with the raw foods diet.
sentences.chinese: 我试验了30天的长寿饮食和生食饮食。

sentences.english: Pray or ask for the long life of masters.
sentences.chinese: 祈愿或请求上师长寿住世。

sentences.english: Rugao is a city which is famous for its residents' longevity.
sentences.chinese: 如皋，是一个因其居民长寿而闻名的地级市。

sentences.english: Longevity and for banquets, constitute the basis for the Chung Yeung Festival.
sentences.chinese: 求长寿及饮宴，构成了重阳节的基础。

sentences.english: The "Crane Dance"for a long life and the "Peacock Dance"for happiness and beauty.
sentences.chinese: 鹤舞寓意长寿，孔雀舞寓意幸福与美丽。

sentences.english: Longevity is not distorted by self-report.
sentences.chinese: 长寿不受自我报告的歪曲。

sentences.english: On the other hand, the ultra-marathoner might outlive us all.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，终极马拉松运动员可能比我们都要长寿。

sentences.english: The island of Sardinia is home to some of the world's oldest people.
sentences.chinese: 世界上很多最长寿的老人都出自撒丁岛。

sentences.english: But nowadays women outlive men by about five to six years.
sentences.chinese: 但现在女人平均比男人长寿五到六年。

sentences.english: Under such a regimen you'll certainly live long.
sentences.chinese: 你按照这样的养生法一定可以长寿。

sentences.english: No closed-source editor has ever matched this longevity record.
sentences.chinese: 没有一个闭源编辑器能问津这个长寿记录。

sentences.english: The genus "narcissus" includes daffodils and jonquils.
sentences.chinese: 水仙属包括黄水仙和长寿花。

sentences.english: Sanborn has the longevity attributed their religious beliefs.
sentences.chinese: 桑伯恩曾将长寿原因归结于自己的宗教信仰。

sentences.english: Get your feed-water as clean as you can to improve the longevity of the runner.
sentences.chinese: 找最干净的您给水你可以提高亚军长寿。

sentences.english: Move is a healthy source, is also a long-lived secret.
sentences.chinese: 动是健康的源泉，也是长寿的秘诀。

definition: to make life longer/to promise longevity/(this product will) extend your life
the way of maintaining good health
to maintain good health/to raise a child or animal/curing (of concrete etc)
to grow old with unfailing eyes and ears (idiom)
the more sons, the more happiness (idiom)
